Content:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> This seems almost as if it's not random or a mistake, but that the community was targeted. We have seen a very obnoxious troll on bitcointalk making false claims. I wonder if there is some connection. I would have expected more from Reddit, but I guess I have no experience that tells me I should. I'm about ready to ask everyone for help on this, as we are getting no information from Reddit so far. As far as I know, we violated no rules whatsoever.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dukeleto> It's common practice for BTC and BCH (and various zec forks) people to fight and ban each others subreddits and all kinds of shenanigans. I would not be surprised if it's a competitor coin or just some bored internet trolls. Sadly, this is common on Reddit

Author: digital bullion#8223
Content: Hi all,  just curious as to how many threads I should be running in the Verus mining wallet, as to achieve the greatest efficiency and chance of mining a block. I am just mining with my desktop cpu.  Any advice is appreciated üßê

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> I just have a shitty laptop on it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <CryptoAlex> Not sure if this apply for mining, but usually a CPU can handle one thread for each core. Some of them have "hyper threading technology" and can handle two threads for each core. If you are using windows just press Ctrl+Shift+Esc and look for "Logical Processors" under Performance tab

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Hollowman9000> Mining about 24 hours, no blocks (none expected, the math says I should get one every 11-12 days)
